channel.title: BBC Sport | Olympics | World Edition
channel.description: Visit BBC Sport for all the action as it happens - up-to-the-minute news, results, breaking news, video, audio and feature stories. BBC Sport covers the major events and all the professional football clubs in the UK, plus cricket, rugby, golf, tennis, motorsport and all the main world sports.

item.title: Live - Olympics
item.description: Nicole Cooke wins gold for Britain in the women's road race after US swimmer Michael Phelps wins the first of a possible eight titles.

item.title: Sprinter Thanou barred from Games
item.description: Greece's Katerina Thanou is excluded from the Beijing Games after the International Olympic Committee (IOC) refused to accredit her.

item.title: Phelps claims first Beijing gold
item.description: Michael Phelps claims the first of the eight gold medals he has targeted after winning the 400m individual medley in a world record time.

item.title: China defend women's diving title
item.description: Defending world and Olympic champions Guo Jingjing and Wu Minxia win gold for China in the synchronised three metre springboard diving.

item.title: Cooke grabs first GB gold medal
item.description: Nicole Cooke claims Britain's first gold medal of the Beijing Olympics by winning a thrilling women's road race.

item.title: Ronaldinho shines in Brazil win
item.description: Brazil captain Ronaldinho scores two goals in seven minutes to book Brazil's place in the Olympic quarter-finals in a 5-0 thrashing over New Zealand.

item.title: Rice sees off Hoff for shock gold
item.description: Australian swimmer Stephanie Rice wins the Olympic women's 400m individual medley and leaves favourite Katie Hoff back in third.

item.title: Park secures 400m freestyle gold
item.description: South Korean teenager Park Tae-hwan takes Olympic gold in the men's 400m freestyle final in Beijing.

item.title: South Korea clinch archery gold
item.description: Defending Olympic champions South Korea win gold in the women's team archery competition by beating China.

item.title: Blake dodges showers to progress
item.description: James Blake and Nikolay Davydenko both make it through to the second round despite the heavy rain which hit the first day of the Olympic tennis event.

item.title: Olympic shooters appeal for peace
item.description: Russian and Georgian medallists plead for peace as they share an Olympic podium for the first time since the conflict between their countries.

item.title: Thai star wins gold with record
item.description: Thailand's Prapawadee Jaroenrattanatarakoon breaks the Olympic record as she wins the women's 53kg weightlifting.

item.title: Kostelecky wins men's trap gold
item.description: David Kostelecky of the Czech Republic claims gold in the men's trap shooting event.

item.title: Aussies take charge in dressage
item.description: Australia Olympic eventing team lead after the dressage stage with Britain up to fourth position.

item.title: Olympics day three preview
item.description: Teenage British diver Tom Daley bids for an Olympic medal with Blake Aldridge in the 10m synchronised final on Monday.
